com.redhat.rhn.frontend.xmlrpc.errata
Class ErrataHandler

java.lang.Object
  com.redhat.rhn.frontend.xmlrpc.BaseHandler
      com.redhat.rhn.frontend.xmlrpc.errata.ErrataHandler

public class ErrataHandler
extends BaseHandler

ErrataHandler - provides methods to access errata information.

getDetails

public java.util.Map getDetails(java.lang.String sessionKey,
                                java.lang.String advisoryName)
                         throws FaultException
GetDetails - Retrieves the details for a given errata.

Parameters:
sessionKey - The sessionKey for the logged in user
advisoryName - The advisory name of the errata
Returns:
Returns a map containing the details of the errata
Throws:
FaultException - A FaultException is thrown if the errata corresponding to advisoryName cannot be found.

setDetails

public java.lang.Integer setDetails(java.lang.String sessionKey,
                                    java.lang.String advisoryName,
                                    java.util.Map details)
Set erratum details.

Parameters:
sessionKey - User's session key.
advisoryName - The advisory name of the errata
details - Map of (optional) erratum details to be set.
Returns:
1 on success, exception thrown otherwise.

ListAffectedSystems

Parameters:

Returns:

clone

public java.lang.Object[] clone(java.lang.String sessionKey,
                                java.lang.String channelLabel,
                                java.util.List advisoryNames)
                         throws InvalidChannelRoleException
Clones a list of errata into a specified channel

Parameters:
sessionKey - The sessionKey containing the logged in user
channelLabel - the channel's label that we are cloning into
advisoryNames - an array of String objects containing the advisory name of every errata you want to clone
Returns:
Returns an array of Errata objects, which get serialized into XMLRPC
Throws:
InvalidChannelRoleException - if the user perms are incorrect

cloneAsOriginal

public java.lang.Object[] cloneAsOriginal(java.lang.String sessionKey,
                                          java.lang.String channelLabel,
                                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> advisoryNames)
                                   throws InvalidChannelRoleException
Clones a list of errata into a specified cloned channel according the original erratas

Parameters:
sessionKey - The sessionKey containing the logged in user
channelLabel - the cloned channel's label that we are cloning into
advisoryNames - an array of String objects containing the advisory name of every errata you want to clone
Returns:
Returns an array of Errata objects, which get serialized into XMLRPC
Throws:
InvalidChannelRoleException - if the user perms are incorrect

create

public Errata create(java.lang.String sessionKey,
                     java.util.Map errataInfo,
                     java.util.List bugs,
                     java.util.List keywords,
                     java.util.List packageIds,
                     boolean publish,
                     java.util.List channelLabels)
              throws InvalidChannelRoleException
creates an errata

Parameters:
sessionKey - The sessionKey containing the logged in user
errataInfo - map containing the following values: String "synopsis" short synopsis of the errata String "advisory_name" advisory name of the errata Integer "advisory_release" release number of the errata String "advisory_type" the type of advisory for the errata (Must be one of the following: "Security Advisory", "Product Enhancement Advisory", or "Bug Fix Advisory" String "product" the product the errata affects String "errataFrom" the author of the errata String "topic" the topic of the errata String "description" the description of the errata String "solution" the solution of the errata String "references" references of the errata to be created String "notes" notes on the errata
bugs - a List of maps consisting of 'id' Integers and 'summary' strings
keywords - a List of keywords for the errata
packageIds - a List of package Id packageId Integers
publish - should the errata be published
channelLabels - an array of channel labels to publish to if the errata is to be published
Returns:
The errata created (whether published or unpublished)
Throws:
InvalidChannelRoleException - if the user perms are incorrect

delete

public java.lang.Integer delete(java.lang.String sessionKey,
                                java.lang.String advisoryName)
                         throws FaultException
Delete an erratum.

Parameters:
sessionKey - session of the logged in user
advisoryName - The advisory Name of the erratum to delete
Returns:
1 on success, exception thrown otherwise.
Throws:
FaultException - if unknown or invalid erratum is provided.

                      java.lang.String advisory,
                      java.util.List channelLabels)
               throws InvalidChannelRoleException
Publishes an existing (unpublished) errata to a set of channels

Parameters:
sessionKey - session of the logged in user
advisory - The advisory Name of the errata to publish
channelLabels - List of channels to publish the errata to
Returns:
the published errata
Throws:
InvalidChannelRoleException - if the user perms are incorrect
